title: [BUG] Multi index columns should be supported or cause a warning / exception
body:
Multi column indices are not supported by sktime, but no errors are raised when such data is presented.

However, unlogical results can be returned, e.g. an extra column header row is included in the output, see the following example. Potentially other errors can arise too, since such a data format is not included in the tests.

So either we should raise an warning or an error when such data is presented, or support such a data format.

```
from sktime.datasets import load_longley
from sktime.forecasting.exp_smoothing import ExponentialSmoothing
import pandas as pd
# create multivaritate data with multi column index
_, y = load_longley()
y.columns = pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples(zip(y.columns, y.columns), names=["l1", "l2"])

# run forecaster
forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing()
forecaster.fit(y)
y_pred = forecaster.predict(fh=[1, 2, 3])
```
